delete_modal.warning_start: Are you sure you want to delete the goal
delete_modal.warning_end: permanently? This action cannot be undone.
delete_modal.impact_notice: Deletion will affect related estimates and hierarchy.

set_values.title: Set points for purpose
set_values.help_tooltip: You can assign value calculations for objectives by giving them relative weights ('goal points').
set_values.helper_required: All fields must be filled out

cost_time.title: Set costs and time
cost_time.desc_monetary: The cost represents the expected lifecycle costs for each individual epic.
cost_time.desc_relative: The cost represents the expected lifecycle cost points for each epic, specified in relative points.
cost_time.desc_time: Time is the expected relative time to complete each epic. This is a relative value and is therefore not measured in hours or days.
cost_time.helper_all_fields: All fields must be filled out.

select.label: Choose which goal levels you want to evaluate
select.desc_epic: Distribute benefit points among epics to estimate how much each epic contributes to each planned benefit. Take one benefit at a time and distribute 100 points among the epics.
select.desc_benefit: Distribute benefit points among planned benefits to estimate how much each planned benefit contributes to the overall Objectives.

empty_state.header: Something went wrong, or there are no goals here
empty_state.description: You can add goals by clicking the button below

estimation_container.stepwise_tooltip: Assign benefit points one goal at a time

analysis.title: Periodization
analysis.description: This page provides an overview of the estimation of benefits and costs over time. By selecting profiles for each epic below, you can see how the financial plan develops and changes based on the distribution.
analysis.loading: Loading Epics or no Epics found...

table.title: List of Epics and Profile Selections

modal.title: Convert Points to NOK (Millions)
modal.description: Enter the conversion factors to transform Benefit Points (BP) and Cost Points (SP) into a calculated value in Million NOK. Changes update the financial plan immediately.

chart.title: Financial Plan (Benefit, Cost, Net) Over Time
chart.description: The chart combines Gross Benefit (BP), Gross Cost (SP), Net Value (bars), and Accumulated NPV (line, right axis). Break-even is marked where the accumulated NPV line crosses the zero line.

benefit.delay_peak_det: Delay with peak effect and gradual deterioration
benefit.imm_increase: Immediate effect with steady increase to stable level
benefit.beginners_det: Rapid increase, peak and rapid deterioration (Beginner enthusiasm)

cost.dev1_uniform: High development (1 period) with uniform subsequent operation
cost.dev1_decreasing: High development (1 period) with decreasing subsequent operation
cost.high_dev_low_dec: Very high dev (1 period) with low, decreasing subsequent operation
cost.low_dev_increasing: Low development (1 period) with increasing subsequent operation
cost.high_dev_decreasing: High development (1 period) with decreasing subsequent operation

welcome.title: BenefitOKR
welcome.body: Thank you for using BenefitOKR – a tool for Benefits Management with OKR. Here is a brief introduction to the project page.

intro.title: Introduction and Help
intro.body: More information on how to use BenefitOKR can be found under Introduction.

structure_info.title: Goal Structure
structure_info.body: This page allows you to manage all goal collections. The structure follows the OKR framework: Objectives, Key Results, and Initiatives (Epics).

purpose_input.title: Purpose
purpose_input.body: Enter the project purpose directly in the field and press '✓' when finished.

add_goal.title: Create Goal
add_goal.body: Under Actions, you'll find a plus sign. Use it to create goals for that specific table. Try it now!

edit_delete.title: Edit/Delete
edit_delete.body: Here you can edit or delete goals you have created.

cost_time.title: Cost/Time
cost_time.body: For each Epic, you can distribute costs and add time usage.

objective_weight.title: Objective Weight
objective_weight.body: Here you can distribute benefit points directly, as Objectives represent the highest level in the hierarchy.

estimation_nav.title: Estimation
estimation_nav.body: The remaining benefit points are distributed in the Estimation tab.

relation.title: Relation Evaluation
relation.body: Select which relationship you want to evaluate to assign benefit points.

distribute.title: Distribute Points
distribute.body: In this table, distribute benefit points to each task to assess its contribution to the goals.

analysis_nav.title: Periodization
analysis_nav.body: Next is periodization, used to distribute benefit points over time.

estimation_labels.distributed_all: Distributed points to each upper goals
estimation_labels.clear_or_distribute: Clear or distribute points to all upper goals

clear_points_modal.title: Warning: Clear Points
clear_points_modal.body: This action will clear all distributed points. Are you sure you want to continue?

introduction_page.title: Welcome to BenefitOKR
introduction_page.intro_text: BenefitOKR management is a strategic approach to assess whether project investments can be justified based on the value they provide. More information about BenefitOKR management can be found below.

understand_box.subtitle: Involves:
understand_box.bullet_1: Assessing what benefits a project is expected to deliver, such as improved services or increased sales.
understand_box.bullet_2: Comparing these benefits with the associated life-cycle costs.
understand_box.bullet_3: Continuously monitoring and evaluating development activities to ensure products with high benefit-cost value are delivered.
understand_box.footer: This gives you a metric to estimate the value of development activities, in addition to traditional goals for time, cost, and scope.

procedure_box.subtitle: These are some of the typical steps in the BenefitOKR process you will perform in this app:
procedure_box.step_1: Create a goal collection and add goals for the project (Goal Structure page)
procedure_box.step_2: Assign values – either weighting or monetary value – to all goals (Goal Structure page)
procedure_box.step_3: Assign cost and time to each epic (Goal Structure page)
procedure_box.step_4: Assign benefit points to estimate how much each epic is expected to contribute (benefit) to the goals (Estimation page)
procedure_box.step_5: View and evaluate the order in which epics should be completed (Analysis page)

introduction_page.analysis_box: Analysis is about distributing benefit (BP) and cost (SP) over time to provide a more realistic picture of a project's financial development. Instead of assuming that gains and costs occur immediately, predefined distribution profiles are used to show how value creation and expenses are distributed throughout the project's lifetime. By using such profiles, one can estimate the total benefit and cost for each Epic, and then calculate indicators such as Net Present Value (NPV) and Accumulated NPV. This provides a holistic basis for assessing economic value and risk over time.
